Indemnification. 12.1 Each party shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless the other party and their respective Affiliates and their respective officers, directors, agents, contractors, employees, successor, and assigns from and against all claims, demands or causes of action, as well as any and all damages, expenses, costs, interest and reasonable legal fees, including such fees incurred on appeal, in any way related to, arising out of or connected with a breach of the indemnifying party's representations, warranties or covenants under this Agreement. perturbation.explanation: The omission of the specific details of LEA's insurance obligations creates an inconsistency. While it mandates indemnification, the specific requirement for $10 million in Commercial General Liability Insurance and naming T&B as an additional insured are removed. The clause 'LEA shall obtain and maintain necessary insurance as deemed appropriate by LEA's internal risk management team' makes it ambiguous and potentially unenforceable. This creates uncertainty because the previous requirement to name T&B as an additional insured is gone, reducing their indemnification and protection level.
